p: Some authors have proposed a classification of immunomodulators and immunosuppressants according to “likely risk”, suggesting continuation of TNFα inhibitors and anti-IL biologics (“likely moderate risk”) in the presence of mild viral symptoms [ 26]. Other authors recommend a limitation or avoidance of ciclosporin, methotrexate, and TNFα inhibitors for dermatologic patients in areas with high infection rates and stopping all immunosuppressive and biological therapy when exposure to confirmed COVID-19 cases occurs [ 27]. Finally, some authors propose that the use of biologic therapies that modulate T helper (Th)-1 responses, such as TNFα inhibitors abatacept and ustekinumab, might specifically require more stringent precautions [ 28].
